titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1680: Scienza cabalistica... etc..

notesStmt.note: Title from title page of first work (f. 2r).

1. f.2r-17v: Scienza cabalistica. 2. f.19r-52v: Kabala triangolare di Abramo Auanez Ebreo. 3. f.54r-63r: Cabala Caldaica perfettissima. 4. f.64r-75v: Cabala angelica divina Salomonis in sepulchro Robohamis invenia. 5. f.77r-86r: Kabala chiromantica.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of cabalistic texts that discuss numerology, ciphers, anagrams, and chiromancy with numerous tables and diagrams throughout.

author.name: Charles Rainsford Collection of Alchemical and Occult Manuscripts (University of Pennsylvania)

msItem.title: Kabala triangolare di Abramo Auanez Ebreo, f. 19r
Cabala angelica divina Salomonis in sepulchro Robohamis invenia, f. 64r

supportDesc.extent: 87 leaves : 211 x 148 (169 x 105) mm bound to 218 x 162 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (contemporary paper) + 87 + i (contemporary paper); [1-87]; modern foliation in pencil, lower right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a semi-cursive script by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Pen and ink diagrams of hands for use in chiromancy (f. 77r-81v).

binding.p: Contemporary parchment. Front and back pastedowns are detached from boards. Paper is stained due to mold and moisture damage, particularly the first and last few leaves.

origin.p: Written in Italy in the 18th century.

history.provenance: Sold at auction at Sotheby's (London), 15 July 2014, as part of Lot 411.
Formerly owned by Charles Rainsford (British army officer, fellow of the Royal Society, and alchemist); bequeathed by Rainsford to Hugh Percy, Second Duke of Northumberland.
Owned by the 2nd through 12th Dukes of Northumberland, ms. 591, Alnwick Castle, Northumberland, 1809-2014.
